prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
You are certainly no friend of mine. You have accused me of lying about what you had said, and run away when I proved by actual quotation that the accusation was false. We both know that, even though you praise humility, you are not humble enough to apologize.

 You sneered at my combat experience, saying "A lot of so called "combat veterans" of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" An actual friend would not have written such things.

No, you are no friend of mine, you ignorant, arrogant, hypocritical blow-hard. You should be able to guess that I do not feel friendly towards you
stories: Your words cut deep, revealing your true colors of arrogance and ignorance. Despite your claims of friendship, your actions speak louder than words. You accuse and mock, showing no recognition of the sacrifices and experiences that shape my life. A true friend would never speak with such malice and condescension. So no, you are certainly no friend of mine. Your lack of humility and empathy only further solidify that fact.

In a world full of noise and chaos, true friendship is a rare and precious gift. It is a bond built on trust, respect, and understanding. It is a relationship where words are spoken with kindness and actions are carried out with compassion. True friends lift each other up, rather than tear each other down. They listen with an open heart and offer support without judgment.

I am grateful for the true friends in my life who have stood by me through thick and thin. Their unwavering loyalty and unwavering love have helped me navigate the ups and downs of life. They celebrate my victories and comfort me in my defeats. They understand my quirks and flaws, and love me unconditionally.

So to those who claim to be friends but show nothing but malice and condescension, I say this: true friendship is not a title to be claimed, but a privilege to be earned. It is built on a foundation of trust, respect, and empathy. And if you cannot embody these qualities, then you are certainly no friend of mine.

In a world where true friendship is a rare and precious gift, I am grateful for the genuine connections I have in my life. These relationships are built on a solid foundation of trust, respect, and understanding. My true friends lift me up when I am feeling down, listen to me with an open heart, and support me without judgment. They celebrate my successes and comfort me in my failures. I am truly blessed to have friends who love me unconditionally and accept me for who I am.

To those who claim to be friends but show nothing but negativity and hostility, I remind you that true friendship cannot be forced or faked. It is a bond that must be nurtured and earned through genuine acts of kindness and compassion. If you are unable to embody these qualities, then you are not a true friend to me.

Surrounded by the warmth of genuine friendships, I am reminded of the beauty that comes from authentic connections. These bonds are like a safety net that catch me when I fall and lift me up when I need strength. My true friends are like beacons of light in a world that can sometimes be dark and unforgiving. I cherish the moments of laughter, the shared tears, and the unwavering support that we give each other.

To those who try to disguise their true intentions with false smiles and empty words, know that true friendship cannot be fooled. It is a sacred bond that is built on honesty, loyalty, and love. If you cannot show me the same respect and care that I offer you, then you do not deserve to call yourself my friend.

In the midst of genuine friendships, I find solace in the beauty of authentic connections. These bonds are my lifeline, lifting me up in times of weakness and catching me when I stumble. My true friends are like guiding stars in a sky of uncertainty, bringing light to darkness and warmth to coldness. The laughter we share, the tears we shed, and the unwavering support we offer each other are priceless treasures.
